venue.name: Somerville Senior Center, Tufts Administration Building

item.description:
Everyone is invited to Somerville, Massachusetts, all runners and walkers, to celebrate life, the coming of spring, and to enjoy a memorable race and St. Patrick's Day celebration. 

Ras na hEireann is the most genuine Irish race this side of the Atlantic. It is a celebration of traditions dating back centuries - and simply a celebration of spring in Somerville, Massachusetts.

5000 registered runner & walker limit
Sold out weeks in advance every year
since 2004

The U.S.A. race will be held on Sunday, March 13, 2011 starting at 11:00 a.m., beginning and ending in Davis Square. You can register online or by mail.  There will be loads of Craic - a celebration and appreciation of heritage and history, the magic and mystery that move everyone to be Irish on St. Patrick's Day. Yes, a St. Patrick's Day Celebration on the Run - the Ras na hEireann U.S.A. 5Km.

This race is a gem, an Emerald to be sure, and has become a local spring tradition over the last seven years. This Ras (race) and Craic (party) will indeed be celebrations—for everyone.

For many 2011 participants, however, it will be an outing to jog or walk just to join in the fun. Runners and walkers will enjoy a memorable race and St. Patrick's Day celebration. Get the registrations in early, and don't be left out. At the Ras na hEireann U.S.A. 5Km everyone will feel like a winner.
item.why: Come on Jumbos, let's get a little exercise and then share a pint in honor of St. Patrick's Day. Keep reading for more details about the registration, t-shirt & number pick-up, race, and post-race party.
item.name: Irish Race, Walk, & Party in Davis Square
